meanings.def: a device containing paper, sand, chemicals, etc. that a liquid or gas is passed through in order to remove any materials that are not wanted
examples: filter paper for the coffee machine

meanings.def: a device that allows only particular types of light or sound to pass through it
examples: The camera has an anti-glare filter.

meanings.def: a program that processes information to leave out the types that are not wanted, or that stops particular types of electronic information, email, etc. from being sent to a computer
examples: Spam filters block out almost all threats.

meanings.def: a light on a set of traffic lights showing that traffic can turn left (or right) while traffic that wants to go straight ahead or turn right (or left) must wait
a tool on digital cameras, photo apps, etc. that allows you to change the appearance of an image
examples: The software allows you to apply filters, remove blemishes and add doodles or text to your images.

meanings.def: to pass liquid, light, etc. through a special device, especially to remove something that is not wanted
examples: All drinking water must be filtered.
Use a sun block that filters UVA effectively.
(figurative) My secretary is very good at filtering my calls (= making sure that calls that I do not want do not get through).

meanings.def: to use a special program to check the content of emails or websites before they are sent to your computer
to move slowly in a particular direction
examples: The doors opened and people started filtering through.
More details about the crash are filtering through.

meanings.def: to come into a place slowly or in small amounts
examples: Sunlight filtered in through the curtains.

meanings.def: to turn left (or right) at traffic lights while other vehicles wanting to go straight ahead or turn right (or left) must wait
